dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Dunque… Almeno per questa missione, vi imboccheremo. L'unica cosa che vi si chiede è di fare i bravi e portare a termine dei semplici compiti.

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Leggete i documenti dentro questa busta, e fate esattameeeeeente quello che c'è scritto sulla carta.
Il modo in cui Saude prolungò la vocale mi provocò un po', ma decisi di non discutere.
E anche se l'avessi fatto, lei avrebbe sentito solo il ticchettio dell'orologio.
Non c'è molta collaborazione in questa “operazione congiunta”, o sbaglio? Ci state praticamente dicendo di seguirvi e basta.
Ci state davvero offendendo. Ci avete preso per dei marinai inesperti o che?
Manager, per favore, non possiamo farci mettere i piedi in testa e…
E…
…fare come dicono loro, credo?
<Eh?>
I… documenti che ci hanno dato. Sono impeccabili.
Guarda qui. I vari percorsi sono stati segnati, e c'è tutto. Sono passati secoli dall'ultima volta che ho visto un piano così chiaro e meticoloso.
Mhm, senz'altro. Ciò indica la loro conoscenza nel saper progettare bene le operazioni.
Ah, ma ciò non vuol dire che possano competere con la sua competenza, Manager.
Mi convinsi grazie ai commenti positivi di Ishmael, aprendo la busta e leggendo attentamente il riassunto dell'operazione.
L'obiettivo può essere riassunto in una frase:
'Raggiungere il piano più alto del casinò.'
La ragione principale alla base di questo piano è il premio in palio per il vincitore del gioco che si terrà oggi.
Stando alla documentazione, vincere il gioco del piano più alto del casinò è l'unico modo per ottenere l'accesso all'area con il Ramo Dorato.
I quattro Sindacati che hanno scommesso assieme sul casinò si cimenteranno in questo gioco…
Di questi quattro… Noi useremo il nome della famigerata…
<Gang Tingtang?>
Un nome non riflette necessariamente la vera natura di un'organizzazione, si tratta di un pregiudizio frivolo.
Osservare il mondo tramite le lenti del pregiudizio non è ideale.
<…Chiaro.>
…Tornando al piano, faremo finta di essere il capo della 'Gang Tingtang' e vinceremo il gioco.
Una volta fatto ciò, dovremo andare nei sotterranei, dov'è locato il Ramo Dorato.

In vista del gioco, per entrare nelle nostre rispettive parti useremo gli oggetti e gli indumenti che possiamo trovare ai banchi dei pegni, entreremo nel casinò, ed aspetteremo che il gruppo al piano più alto vinca il gioco.
E questo è il sunto del piano, almeno credo…
Un secondo. Se non si riesce a vincere il gioco, che succederebbe?

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Abbiamo preparato anche di documenti d'identità falsi, in caso la sicurezza decida di fare un'ispezione casuale ai visitatori.
D'accordo, fila tutto liscio, ma… Qual'è il piano per vincere, una volta arrivati al piano più alto?

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Secondo te i vestiti per cosa sono?

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Abbiamo passato mesi ad allenarci per sembrare dei veri croupier.

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Vi faremo da portafortuna. Il gioco è praticamente vinto, vi basta solo avere un paio di occhi funzionanti.
Effie mormorò sottovoce l'ultima parte della frase, mentre lanciava un'occhiataccia a tutti noi.
Ci fece capire che non aveva assolutamente fiducia in noi.
E come ci sostituiamo al capo della Gang Tingtang Gang?

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Metteremo dei sedativi nel cibo che viene servito al casinò. Abbiamo già definito i dettagli con il capo chef.
Sedativi…
Saude ed Effie si scambiarono un occhiolino.
Un gesto che dimostrava quanto i due fossero in sintonia, capaci persino di leggere l'uno i pensieri dell'altra con un solo sguardo.

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Ehilà, carissimo~ Vogliamo dare un'occhiata a quello che hai in vetrina~

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: Oh? Oh! Ma certo, signorina, fate pure con calma.
L'atteggiamento del negoziante cambiò improvvisamente, passando da sprezzante a servile.

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Ottimo, allora prenderemo direttamente quello che ci serve.
Oh cielo! Questa è una Spilla di design Guppcha!

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: Certo~ Hai proprio un occhio attento, giovanotto. Questa bellezza è il fiore all'occhiello del nostro catalogo. Sono state prodotte solo dieci spille, vale almeno­—
Il mio cane ne aveva una attaccata al collare che usavamo per portarlo a passeggiare. È magnifico vedere qualcosa legato a dei bei ricordi!

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.

dataList.content: Ooh, io voglio questi guanti di pelle di mucca. Il vecchio proprietario deve essere stato un gran modaiolo~

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Siete pregati di prendere solo gli indumenti pertinenti al ruolo che andrete a ricoprire.
Perdonate la mia insolenza, ma nella missiva che ho ricevuto v'è scritto “inserviente”. C'è stato di sicuro un errore!
Okay, va bene tutto, ma… Avete i soldi per pagare tutta questa roba?

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Davvero vi preoccupate di quanto andremo a spendere? Chi pensiate che siamo, impiegati che vengono pagati due spicci? Questa 'Carta Nera' può comprare di tutto, senza preoccuparsi del prezzo.
Dante! Cos'è 'sta roba?! Mi avevi detto che non potevamo comprare la carne di manzo perché non avevamo i fondi!
Dunque è vero che ai gruppi con risultati costanti ed ottimi viene assegnata una carta aziendale, senza un tetto di spesa.
Mentre tutti erano increduli per l'esistenza della leggendaria Carta Nera…
Sentimmo una forte voce provenire dall'esterno.

dataList.teller: Membro Tingtang con la voce roca
dataList.title: Gang Tingtang
dataList.content: Oi, vecchio rimbambito! Non ti avevo detto che la scadenza per pagare era oggi?
Someone who clearly belongs to a vicious Syndicate entered the pawnshop.

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: P-Please… give me one more chance. I swear I'll have the money ready.

dataList.teller: Membro Tingtang con la voce roca
dataList.title: Gang Tingtang
dataList.content: One more? Can't ya do basic math? Ya said the same thing last time! Boss won't like me wasting precious time reteaching you kindergarten, ya hear?

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: I-I'm just a frail old man standing on doddery feet, there's really nothing you'll get out of shaking me down…!
Pleading with an overtly loud voice, the Negoziante looked at us.

dataList.teller: Membro Tingtang con la voce roca
dataList.title: Gang Tingtang
dataList.content: Eh? Ya talking back now? Yeah, go on then, get mad! I won't feel so guilty that way!
In a way, he looked like he was covertly begging us to help him, based on his expression.
The Sinners' attention was naturally drawn to the ongoing row.

dataList.teller: Membro Tingtang con la voce roca
dataList.title: Gang Tingtang
dataList.content: What're ya lookin' at? Ya think I'm playing?!
Gee… That was so stereotypical, I didn't even get an urge to reply. Can't people be more creative about throwing taunts?
Shouldn't we… help out, maybe?
Unlike Ishmael, who scoffed at the goon, Sinclair anxiously glanced over.

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: We have no choice, the Backstreets have their own rules and order. We aren't the ones to disturb that complex web of their society.

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Outsiders like us will only cause a bigger scene if we try to step in.
Pleased by the Sinners choosing to stay away, the goon continued with the extortion.

dataList.teller: Membro Tingtang con la voce roca
dataList.title: Gang Tingtang
dataList.content: Hmph, if y'ain't got money, why don't ya pay your dues in that instead? We keep telling you.

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: A-Anything but that… Please…
<…Is it really okay to leave them be?>
Shall I settle the dispute for them so it does not bother you, Manager?
What does that toughster mean by “that”, anyway?
…A currency more valuable than money exists in this District.
It's well known that J Corp's Singularity is a powerful security technology capable of locking anything.
What is less known, however, is the extensive cultural and historical background of the Backstreets of Nest J that lead to the Singularity's creation.
H, history…? Are you seriously about to lecture us here and now…? I was never told about any mandatory education when I joined this company!
In spite of the opposition, Faust went on with her explanation.
Here, a technology exists to extract 'wishpower' from people.
Though it's not widely known outside this District since it didn't quite have the generality to be recognized as a Singularity.
In essence, it's processing 'luck' into a commodity that can be traded. Like a form of money.

It brought forth the need for a way to stop others from forcibly extracting this wishpower, leading to the creation of a security technology that ultimately developed into the Singularity we know today.

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Gee-wee, Faust~ Must be tiring having to teach these dunces in ways they can get it.
It's fine, this was within my anticipated scenario.
I don't like the way you say that…

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Come on now, gather the items to help with your disguises so we can leave.
Saude flapped the document full of scheduled plans to emphasize that we'd be busy.

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: We're salaried workers, not “heroes” fighting for justice.
<Wait… Not that word…!>
A bad feeling rushing through my head prompted me to count the Sinners I could see.
<That… does not align with a certain someone's… beliefs…>
And it's one that would severely provoke her principles…!
Ishmael seems to have noticed what I meant, and hurriedly looked around.
Thou darest try to pilfer the valuables of others? This behavior can only be seen as wholehearted villainy!
<Oh no…! Don Quixote…!>
But it was a moment too late.
Don Quixote had already sprinted forward and was swinging her lance at the Tingtanger who gripped the Negoziante by the collar.
WHACK!
Caught completely unaware, the goon was hit right on the head with the blunt side of her lance.
Knocked out on the floor in a frisky swing, the fainted goon became the center of attention for all of us inside the pawnshop for a solid minute.
Ah, for your information, keeping the Sinners in check is not part of my job description. That would be the job of this person here.
<Don't give me that look. There's nothing in my abilities to keep her under control…>
I couldn't stop myself from defending my position even when I was aware that my voice wouldn't reach anyone besides the Sinners.
Oh well. It's not like my defense would've made them look any less baffled towards me if they could hear it.

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: Oooh…!
The Negoziante was the only one chuffed by this turn of events.

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: Great work, ma'am. Serves that hooligan right! But I'll say, you could've whopped 'em a tad harder, maybe.
Vergilius advised me that while I am free to deliver justice unto villains, I must do so without unduly involving irrevelants in our mission! Thus, I showed moderation!
Her proud expression never looked so provoking.
<Uh-huh. So you remembered his words and still leapt forward?>
'Twas a necessary action to stay true to my creed. Please understand my virtuous violence!

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: Not to kill the mood, but… That ruffian isn't actually dead, right?
I thought you wanted her to get straight to wallops, old sport?

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: I did, I did… But things would get fairly complicated if the Yurodiviye showed up, you know.
The Yurodiviye? What are they doing here… No, forget that, why are you worrying about them?

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: Not up to date with the news, are you, ma'am? They've been causing trouble here for months now.
Are they villains as well?!

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: Oh, they're villains to us humble merchants for sure. They were going on about, what was it, roughing up greedy peddlers keeping money to themselves, and giving it to those who need it. Distributing something, they said…
The redistribution of wealth.

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: Aah~ That's it, yes. Those scoundrels are robbing us poor saps of what little wealth we have. And they don't even do the dirty work themselves, it's always the local brutes they send. Can you believe it?

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: Anyhoo, life has been hard for us because of those self-righteous bunches. Looked like they were here to find something at first, but all they do now is squeeze money outta us…
…Ah! I-I just realized, shouldn't we take our leave now? More toughies from the Tingtang Gang might be coming this way.
It seemed like Rodya deliberately cut off the Negoziante in a hurry, but I had little time to think about the implications.
The gang member Don Quixote had knocked out began to flinch as though to get back up soon.

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Sigh, what a hassle… You're making the problem bigger than it had to be.
Hey, Muffin and Sablé, was it? Don't be so tart now. There are plenty of pawnshops around here, right? We can always find a different—

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: It's Effie and Saude. Please don't mistake our names for confections.

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: And your statement that there are plenty of pawnshops in the vicinity won't mean much…

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: …When said pawnshops notice the trouble happening here and close…
<Don Quixote…!>

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: I'm getting tired of lecturing these idiots on every little thing. We should just leave.
Right as I tried to leave, someone wearing similar thuggish clothes to the one we'd just knocked out—with a face that looked just as rough—stormed into the shop.

dataList.title: Tingtang Gang
dataList.content: Ayo, codger, have you seen our li'l—

dataList.title: Tingtang Gang
dataList.content: Wee slimmy! Just what's going on here?!
We did our best to pretend to be innocent customers who just happened to be in the pawnshop at the wrong time.
However, in an unfortunate concurrence of events, the goon came back to senses…

dataList.title: Tingtang Gang
dataList.content: Who did this?! Tell me now! That bean is gonna regret the day they grew stems!

dataList.title: Tingtang Gang
dataList.content: Gnh… O… Over there…

dataList.title: Tingtang Gang
dataList.content: That red… timepuss…
The direction that finger was pointing was simply too unambiguous for me to pretend otherwise.
Plus, there's no point in denying that I was meant by “red timepuss”, as I'm sure there would be literally no one else matching that description in this entire District.

dataList.title: Banco dei Pegni della J Corp.
dataList.content: Just so you don't get the wrong idea, I have nothing to do with these people or what happened here. I was just about to bring a towel to cool this poor fellow's head.
That smarmy gaffer…
I had no expectations for him in the first place, but that man really has a shaky reed for his backbone.
Although the Negoziante switching sides in a heartbeat and the finger-pointing clock slander—over something I wasn't responsible for, too—hurt me a little, I was determined to stand firm.

dataList.title: Tingtang Gang
dataList.content: Jah… Frijolitos over there… Stop. Freeze in your tracks.
Mostly because it was clear that we had to run right now.
If I kept letting small things bother me, I would be reduced to a pulp sooner rather than later.
Bah. No need to run. Let's just kill them all and be done with it.

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: What's next? You're going to wipe out the whole Syndicate?
Heh. That doesn't sound too bad.
The forces of evil must be uprooted with haste in order to raise the banner of justice high!

dataList.title: LCCB
dataList.content: Uh, so, is there seriously no one on your team who's in their right mind?
Ishmael looked insulted by this remark and seemed to be thinking of a counterargument, but the Tingtang goons arming themselves were a more pressing matter.
<Let's just…>
<Let's get outta here first!>
